tweets.author: Tech Dev Notes
tweets.text:
xAI is building A Pure AI Software Company, Macrohard

Since companies like Microsoft focus solely on software without producing physical hardware, their operations could theoretically be fully replicated or automated by AI agents working together in a digital environment, like virtual coworkers in simulated machines

"This is a macro challenge and a hard problem with stiff competition" - Elon

Join@xAI

tweets.author: Elon Musk
tweets.text:
Grok is evolving much faster than any other AI.

If this rate of progress continues,@xAIwill outpace other AI companies by a significant margin.

App upgrades are roughly on par with internal upgrades.

tweets.author: Zeeshan Patel
tweets.text:
Many people wonder what is the benefit of training video gen models. Video gen by itself doesn‚Äôt necessarily seem to provide as much raw intelligence to users as modern LLMs. 

However, in the long term, video gen models will be used as neural simulations of the universe within which we can train agents to explore and learn from information rich environments. There are many open problems to solve, but if it works, we‚Äôll eventually have entire datacenters simulating the universe to train superintelligence. If you‚Äôd like to join us@xAIto push the frontier of world models / video gen, please reach out!

tweets.author: Elon Musk
tweets.text:
Join@xAIand help build a purely AI software company called Macrohard. It‚Äôs a tongue-in-cheek name, but the project is very real!

In principle, given that software companies like Microsoft do not themselves manufacture any physical hardware, it should be possible to simulate them entirely with AI.

tweets.author: AI Notkilleveryoneism Memes ‚è∏Ô∏è
tweets.text:
I'm sorry, but "LLMs can't reason in 2025" is a truly embarrassing take.

You can literally watch them reason IN PLAIN ENGLISH in front of your very own eyes.

Reasoning Deniers are the flat earthers of AI

"Ackchyually one paper says" bro JUST LOOK UP

You can TRIVIALLY prove yourself that they can generate novel ideas - just ask it to "invent 10 things no human has ever thought of before" or a million other similar prompts.

And, I'm sorry to inform you of this, but if you can't get even an LLM to generate A SINGLE PIECE of new information, then you are the stochastic parrot.

Btw, that paper NEVER said LLMs can't reason at all, just that they have SOME limitations. No shit?? Insanely bad takes on the TL today

quoted_tweet.author: AI Notkilleveryoneism Memes ‚è∏Ô∏è
